TITLE: ğŸ¶ Do you listen to classical music at work?
TEXT:
ğŸ¶ Do you listen to classical music at work? 

If not, try it, it can do wonders.

Music is a certain arrangement of sounds. 

â†’ If you arrange sounds in a certain way, it will become noise.
â†’ If you arrange sounds in a different way, it will become music. 

Thereâ€™s a whole lot of noise passing as music right now. ğŸ˜…

I've always been fascinated by music since my childhood, and over the year I became my best ally to focus at work.

If you know something about classical music, you would see classical music involves an enormous amount of mathematic behind it.

Thereâ€™s a structure.

A mathematical structure in which classical music is been built. 

As far as I am concerned, when I listen to classical music, it's like a shot of energy. I can get into a "flow state" where I can create better pieces of work.

In some way, music recreates creation in a sound form: a wave! 

With ups and downs. 
Like in everything in life.

Creation is just a complex amalgamation of sounds or reverberations.
Music is an attempt to imitate life in a different form.

Will people get healthy and well by this? Definitely, if you hit the right pitch ğŸ™

Here is my recommendation for your next 2 hours of work. 

#Mozart
#Bach
#Vilvaldi
#Corelli
...and more

Try to get into the flow. ğŸ˜‰

and let me know!

Have a nice weekend.

TITLE: ğŸ˜¬ THE STAKES ARE HIGH IN GETTING DATA RIGHT
TEXT:
ğŸ˜¬ THE STAKES ARE HIGH IN GETTING DATA RIGHT

According to Accenture research, 66% of asset managers say that data management at their company needs to be completely disrupted.ğŸŒª

They need a â€œdata reinventionâ€. 

A framework to develop their ability to analyze vast amounts of data, sometimes in real-time, to fuel growth, product innovation, and deliver world-class customer service.Â 

Yet, if you asked asset managers:
"Can you turn your data into an asset to achieve a competitive edge?"

...only a few would say yes

So, the stakes are high in getting data right.

Where are firms struggling regarding data?Â 

- Data fragmentation and disparate versions of â€œthe truthâ€Â 
- Proliferation of data sources
- Rising costs of data management
- Lack of an enterprise data strategy

What should a firm do to transform data into a REAL asset?

â†’ Invest in the long term on three interconnected actions:

1. Business â†’ Build a strong data foundation
ğŸ‘‰ Create an effective data management program, which includes data governance, data quality and master data management; technology platforms and data architectures; and data supply chain management.

2. Technology â†’ Harness advanced technologies
ğŸ‘‰ Use artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning, and analytics to develop critical insights from data and micro-decision making.

3. People â†’ Create a data-driven culture
ğŸ‘‰ Manage the people and cultural dimensions/impacts of advanced data management.


This post is a summary of Accenture's report on "The power of data-driven asset management". 
See the link in the comments.


QUESTION â†’ Do you find those 3 actions also important in your company? 

Please share your views ğŸ‘ ğŸ‘ ğŸ’¬

TITLE: ğŸ˜± Working with GitHub is the most undervalued skill in data science!
TEXT:
ğŸ˜± Working with GitHub is the most undervalued skill in data science! 

But it's by far the most powerful. 

Github is a web-based platform used forÂ version control = to keep your code SAFE.

Git simplifies the process of working with other people and makes it easy to collaborate on projects.

Team members can work on files and easily merge their changes with the master branch of the project.

ğŸš¨ And yet, I meet a lot of people that do not know (or never had the chance) to work and see a full end-to-end Git workflow. 

Even worst, they are sometimes scared to use it because of the "hardcore" command lines you need to execute...and prefer the manual rename of their files to version their work ğŸš¨

To be honest, I was scared too ğŸ˜…

But you don't need command lines to use Git ğŸ˜

At naas.ai we started using the module inside JupyterLab,

it works just fine! ğŸš€

Our complete open source project workflow is now 100% relying on GitHub. 

- the roadmap 
- the issues => PR handling 
- the documentation 
- the onboarding of our contributors 
- the sponsoring (I'm the only sponsor for now though ğŸ˜‚)

Last Wednesday, we launched our first-ever Newsletter in 9 months.Â 

Yes, we completely missed out on producing a proper update of the project before that.Â 

But even then, our user base has continued to grow to reach +900 accounts opened in 45 countries.ğŸŒ

We listened carefully to userâ€™s feedback, integrated them into our vision of the product and now, we feel like we are on the right track to make Naas the â€œall-in-one open source data platformâ€ everybody needs.ğŸ’š

In this release, all the users can now benefit from the latest version of Naas manager.Â 

And, the crazy thing is that, inside the product, you can now access all the awesome-notebooks template (synced with Github) in 3 clicks ğŸš€:
- Connect to Naas with your Google, GitHub, LinkedIn accountÂ 
- Go to the Naas manager from the launcher page
- Search for the template you need by tool, action, or #tag
- Press the â€œOpen in Naasâ€ button and you are good to go! ğŸ‘‰ The template opens in a few seconds.Â 

This smooth process is something we have been working on for weeks.Â 

We hope you will enjoy it!

Of course, there is much more in this newsletter:Â

TITLE: ğŸ˜°/ğŸ˜ How do you take care of your work-life balance?
TEXT:
ğŸ˜°/ğŸ˜ How do you take care of your work-life balance?

Do you know the US restaurant chain TGIF: "Thanks God It's Friday"?

It's funny but quite true: most people suffer the week, and live for the weekend.Â 


But with all those things happening in the world, let's remember one thing:Â 

ğŸ˜ƒ We are here only to live. ğŸŒ±

Live 100% of the time, not 30%!

Only human beings think they are here for some other higher purpose.Â 

All other creatures know they're here to live.

For them, it means eating - sleeping - reproducing until their life is complete.

But as a human being, you can

- eat as much as you want
- sleep as much as you want,Â 
- reproduce as much as you want,

..and still, your life is incomplete.

This longing for something else is forcing people to pour "spirit" in their glass over the weekend ğŸ· ğŸ¥ƒ

...by lack of spirit in themselves?


Of course, sometimes we need a break for some reason, or we simply like a nice glass of wine, that is perfectly fine.ğŸ˜‰

But if we make this distinction between what is work and what is life, maybe it's because what we do is NOT LIFE.Â 


There is no such thing as work/life balance, in my opinion, there are only different dimensions of life.Â 

From the moment we are born till the day we die, only â˜ï¸1 thing is happening: life!Â 


Do you agree? ğŸ‘‡
I'm curious about learning what's your plans for the weekend in the comment.ğŸ’¬

Enjoy your Friday, and your weekend everybody!

TITLE: ğŸ“° How to create an amazing Product Newsletter?
TEXT:
ğŸ“° How to create an amazing Product Newsletter? 
ğŸ‘‰ 5 things I learned from the Notion official "ğŸŒŸ What's New?" page.

And how I tried to apply it to naas.ai by simply copying their framework.

It's been 9 months since we soft-launched www.naas.ai but we never actually found a way to write a proper newsletter. 

âŒ We never found the right format (email? web page? twit?)
âŒ We never found the right frequency (every time a new feature is released? weekly? monthly? bi-monthly?)
âŒ We never found took the time to reflect on what we actually wanted to do. 

But 2 months ago, I started using Notion more and realized how simple and efficient their product updates were... 

ğŸ‘‰ Here is what I learned from them: 

âœ… Be short: try to limit it your updates in different and paragraph with only a few sentences each.Â 

âœ… Tell stories: adopt a conversational toneÂ to draw your reader in. 

âœ… Focus on the reader: your audience is going to be interested in what you do to help them. 

âœ… Create Call To Actions: make sure youâ€™re asking your readers to do something with your content.

âœ… Make it nice: the team at Notion is clearly focused on the design and this is why I used the same framework for Naas Product Newsletter. Why not copy the best-in-class? 

I hope this short post can help a few people. 

+ of course..that you will learn interesting stuff in this first "REAL" newsletter (ğŸ”— the link is in the comment)

I would love to hear your feedback in the comment section ğŸ‘‡

Thanks a lot! 
Don't forget to share the open-source love ğŸ’š

And, have a nice Wednesday!

TITLE: ğŸ‰ naas.ai has entered the Top 100 of the Pioneer Tournament ğŸ‰ğŸ˜‡
TEXT:
ğŸ‰ naas.ai has entered the Top 100 of the Pioneer Tournament ğŸ‰ğŸ˜‡ 

We are now ranked #84, 6 weeks after we started.

Read below if you want to learn moreğŸ‘‡

Pioneer has been created by a former Apple director, Daniel Gross, who ran the US accelerator Y Combinatorâ€™s AI-track and launched the project as a global talent search fundÂ in 2018/2019.

Pioneer isÂ designed to remotely help determined and ambitious people take their projectÂ to the next level. 

After you submit your initial project description, you'll go through the Pioneer Tournament. 

You have to demonstrate weekly progress, vote on other participants updates

ğŸ‘‰ and see where you stand on their global leaderboard. ğŸ–

Selected experts review players in the Top 50 on the Global Leaderboard and choose new Pioneers as often as every week

If you get selected you'll receive:

ğŸ’ Access to a network of elite founders.
ğŸ’ Free Stripe Atlas company formation.
ğŸ’ Mentorship from some of the worldâ€™s most successful individuals.
ğŸ’ Participation in the Pioneer Demo Livestream, which may help you fundraise.
ğŸ’ and credits on third-party providers like 100K$ Amazon Web Services (AWS) credits or Airtable

ğŸ˜ The funny story is that we got contacted by Jackson Prince from the Pioneer team because one of the startups asked if Naas credits could be included in the package. 

We are not there yet but we started competing in the Tournament and it has been a very interesting journey so far. 

We improved our FOCUS because you need to commit every week to updates on at least 3 KPI's, talk with other founders...

+ you need to do a 1 min pitch video. And this is what I wanted to share today. 

ğŸ‘ likes, feedback, and comments ğŸ’¬ are welcome!

TITLE: â˜ï¸What is the most important thing in your life right now ?
TEXT:
â˜ï¸What is the most important thing in your life right now ? 


Your family 
Your children
Your friends
Your work 
Your money 
â€¦

They all may be important.

But the most important thing is that you are alive!

Itâ€™s because you are alive that all those things are important to you. 

Do you know that every day, more than 150 000 people die ?

It means that at least 2 to 3 times more people lose someone that is close to them.

So if by chance tomorrow you wake up.

Put a big smile on your face.ğŸ˜Š

If the people around you are still alive.

â€¦even bigger smile ğŸ˜ƒ.

If at 9:30 you are still alive, another smile ğŸ˜€.

And every time you check your clock â° just do it! ğŸ˜‰ S.M.I.L.E ğŸ¤—

Because what you are looking at it not your clock, itâ€™s your life ticking away âŒ›ï¸

If you think about mortality at certain times, it can make you depressed.

If you live with it all the time, being joyful will become your natural state ğŸ™


Do everything that you can do, to the best of your ability, live your life to the fullest. 

The most important thing in your life, is that you are ALIVE ğŸ’š Enjoy ğŸ˜‰

TITLE: ğŸ§¨ ğŸ‘¿ What is wrong with Data Project?Â
TEXT:
ğŸ§¨ ğŸ‘¿ What is wrong with Data Project?Â 

Most of the data projects fail because they don't focus on delivering value to the business ASAP! 

Do you agree?Â â¬‡

If you haven't noticed, the business requirements are always changing...

...FAST

...like "REALLY" FAST these days.

What is true today will not be tomorrow.Â 

If you are not familiar with the concept of #DataOps. It might be the missing piece of the puzzle.

ğŸ‘‰ DataOps is a process-driven, automated approach to data delivery and analytics focusing on the value provided to the ===> business.

It uses the agile approach between data owners and technical teams to build data-centric assets for a company.

It borrows methods from #DevOps (focusing on delivering high-quality code faster) and isnâ€™t tied to any one tool or technology. ğŸš€


ğŸ‘‰ Jerome Gransac    ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡­ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º is an engineer that has started his career Finance as a developer working close to the inglorious Bank traders.

He learned DataOps the hard way!Â 

Confronting his scripts to the expected returns of the business has been an eye-opener. ğŸ‘€

After this experience, he became a DataOps advocate in different organizations and is today working for the International Committee of the Red Cross - ICRC  in Switzerland.Â 



ğŸ™ğŸŒ Join me next Tuesday at 6 PM CET to discuss this fascinating topic!

Link in the comment below!
ğŸ‘like and ğŸ’¬comment if you have some questions or opinions already on the matter.

ğŸ¤™
Cheers.

TITLE: ğŸ’šğŸŒğŸ¤™ A welcoming community is an investment into your projectâ€™s future and reputation.
TEXT:
ğŸ’šğŸŒğŸ¤™ A welcoming community is an investment into your projectâ€™s future and reputation. 

If your #opensource project is just starting to see its first contributions, start by giving early contributors a positive experience, and make it easy for them to keep coming back.

========================
ğŸ‘·â€â™€ï¸ğŸ›  Work In Progress at naas.ai 
========================

ğŸ‘ˆ Last Monday, we made our first community call with a small group of contributors. 

The idea was to communicate what each one was working on, and ask for help/guidance if needed.ğŸ™

Once a PR is submitted on GitHub, the core team will do its best to validate it ASAP with detailed feedback. 

Because human interactions and feedback matter.

+ We also wanted to clarify what are the different types of technical contributions on naas.ai :

Type 1ï¸âƒ£ is to create a template following the Naas notebook framework (input/model/output) so that anyone reading it knows what to expect. 
We call them the awesome-notebooks ğŸ˜
=> https://lnkd.in/g64ewPb


Type 2ï¸âƒ£ would be to make python low-code formulas to make the templates more simple, and reusable in other contexts. 
We call them Naas drivers ğŸ => https://lnkd.in/gfjKdRt


Type 3ï¸âƒ£ is for the ones willing to enter the core of the Naas engines. Working closely with us (the core team) on the product roadmap. 
We call them the Naas features => https://lnkd.in/gnySUZ7


ğŸ…=> If you make at least one of your PR is validated and merged, contributors will be granted the status of  "Opensource contributor" 

= you can add Naas as an entity you worked for in your public profile, and we will back you up if you need any recommendations for future jobs. 


This is the commitment we make to the #community. 



ğŸ‘‰ Next Monday, we are willing to open it up to more people. 

ğŸ’¬ If you want to join just comment and I will send the meeting link to you.


Spread the #opensource love ğŸ’š as usual. 
Have an awesome Friday and a beautiful weekend!

I suggest #python ğŸ

TITLE: ğŸ¤¯ "Intellectually, everything that we perform, will look stupid or meaningless with #AI."
TEXT:
ğŸ¤¯ "Intellectually, everything that we perform, will look stupid or meaningless with #AI."

Humans need to realize what a machine cannot do and stop being scared of #AI! 

Human beings have MANY layers of intelligence. 

What we call "intelligence" (we should say "intellect") is only a small part of it.

ğŸ‘‡
The big deal behind #ArtificialIntelligence is that : 
- accumulating information, 
- analyzing it,
- projecting it the way you want, at a given moment
...will no more be considered as a valuable thing in human faculty.

ğŸ‘‰ So it's very important to understand, that :

#intelligence is an individual's ability to acquire skills, knowledge and apply them,

while 

#intellect is the faculty of objectively understanding and reasoning abstract matters.

Modern societies have given too much significance to the intellect
but #machines are better than us at abstracting things.

âœ… So, we all must learn how to do things beyond our #Intellect!


ğŸ§˜â€â™‚ï¸ In the yogic system, the mind is seen as having 16 parts...Four are fundamental:
- Buddhi or intellect, 
- Ahankara or identity, 
- Manas or memory
- Chitta, which is pure intelligence, and if we manage to touch Chitta, we have access to the source of creation.


Check out this awesome 13min video explaining the 4 dimensions of the mind if you want to learn more. ğŸ˜‰

I've been following Sadhguru JV work since I started being an Entrepreneur, it helped me a lot to grow as a better human ğŸ™ğŸ’š

This is #opensource wisdom. Hope you will enjoy it!

TITLE: ğŸš¨ğŸŒ #Opensource projects suffer from terrible misconceptions!
TEXT:
ğŸš¨ğŸŒ #Opensource projects suffer from terrible misconceptions! 

If youâ€™re a new open-source contributor, the process can be intimidating. ğŸ˜±

Yesterday, I posted 7 reasons why you should contribute, but let's be honest, it's not easy to get started.

You ask yourself so many questions like:
ğŸ‘‡

â“How do I find the right project? 
â“What if I donâ€™t know how to code? 
â“What if I do something wrong and break the software? ğŸ¤ª
...

âŒ Do not worry! 

There are all sorts of ways to get involved, but first, let's fix common errors.

1ï¸âƒ£ You donâ€™t have to contribute code
Itâ€™s often the other parts of a project that areÂ most in need (project organization, communication, marketing). Youâ€™ll do the project aÂ hugeÂ favor by offering these skills!

2ï¸âƒ£ You donâ€™t just have to work on software projects!
While â€œopen sourceâ€ often refers to software, you can collaborate on just about anything. There are books, recipes, lists, and classes that get developed as open-source projects.


âœ… YOU could have a BIG impact on all sorts of open-source activities!

ğŸ‘‰ Do you like planning events?
Organize workshops or meetups, conferences, hackathons.

ğŸ‘‰ Do you like design?
Restructure layouts to improve the projectâ€™s experience, conduct user research or interviews.

ğŸ‘‰ Do you like to write?
Start a newsletter for the project, or curate highlights on product updates, write about it on a blog

ğŸ‘‰ Do you like organizing?
Go on the project roadmap and check for duplicate issues, suggest new issue labels for better clarity, ask clarifying questions on issues.

ğŸ‘‰ Do you like helping people?
Answer questions for people on open issues, moderate discussion boards, or conversation channels.

ğŸ‘‰ Do you like helping others code?
Review code on other peopleâ€™s submissions, write tutorials for how a project can be used, offer to mentor another contributor.


Please  ğŸ‘ and reach out if you want to learn more!

TITLE: ğŸ¤” ğŸ–¥  7 reasons why you should contribute to #opensource software.
TEXT:
ğŸ¤” ğŸ–¥  7 reasons why you should contribute to #opensource software.

Are you ready? 
ğŸ‘‡

1ï¸âƒ£ Improve the software you rely on
Lots of open-source contributors start by being users.
When you find a bug, have a question, you can look at the source to see if you can update it yourself.

2ï¸âƒ£ Improve your skills
Whether itâ€™s coding, user interface design, graphic design, writing, or organizing a project... if youâ€™re looking for practice, thereâ€™s always a task for you.

3ï¸âƒ£ Meet people who are interested in similar things
Open-source projects with warm, welcoming communities connect great people together. Many people form lifelong friendships through their participation in open source, online, or in person. 

4ï¸âƒ£ Find mentors and teach others
Working with others on a shared project means youâ€™ll have to explain how you do things, as well as ask other people for help. 

5ï¸âƒ£ Build a portfolio that helps you grow your reputation and career! 
By definition, all of your open source work is public, which means you get free examples to take anywhere as a demonstration of what you can do.

6ï¸âƒ£ Learn people skills
Open source offers opportunities to practice leadership and management skills, such as resolving conflicts, organizing teams of people, and prioritizing work. 

âš ï¸ And often, these skills are underrated!


7ï¸âƒ£ Itâ€™s empowering to be able to make changes, even small ones.
You donâ€™t have to become a lifelong contributor in open source. A typo somewhere? You can fix just that. 

Opensource helps people feel they can have an impact on their world, and that in itself is gratifying.ğŸŒ

TITLE: ğŸ¦¾ Where should you start if you want to implement AI in your company?
TEXT:
ğŸ¦¾ Where should you start if you want to implement AI in your company?
Intuitively, most of us will think ğŸš€ productivity...

âŒ Wrong answer.

A few weeks ago, I had the chance to talk withÂ Carlos ToxtliÂ for 1 hour about the future of work and the role of AI in the workplace during ğŸ¹Â naas.aiÂ Happy hours.

Carlos is an HCI Researcher studying the Future of Work, he has been working as a Data Scientist, CTO, Tech Evangelist, Entrepreneur, Freelancer...

He has worked for some of the biggest corporations in the worldÂ Microsoft,Â Google, and even at theÂ United Nations!


His vision of AI is based on human-centered design, a domain where human is at the center of everything.

When I asked him the question above, he answered :

âœ… User Experience

"Of course, if we look at the computer every 30 min to get a response from an AI, it will be productive but it's not the approach that humans want"
ğŸ‘‡
"Eventually, humans want to have a summarize result at the end of the day and work only 1 hour"


So, to all the wannabeÂ #AIÂ professionals out there, let's focus on the user experience:
ğŸ‘‰ how the human wants to interact with AI
ğŸ‘‰ how often they want this interaction to occur
ğŸ‘‰ when they want to be alerted or prompted, when not.

They are a lot of things to consider in the workflow. It's not only about accuracy and productivity.

"If you understand how the user works, how much time he wants to invest on a given type of task, you will get the productivity you want at the end..."

ğŸ“º To learn more about HCI, AI, the future of work, check out the complete episode!

ğŸ‘ + comment + subscribe to the Youtube channel for more videos.

TITLE: â“ğŸŒ Did you know?

â“ğŸŒ Did you know?
World Environment Day is celebrated annually on 5 June. 

It is the United Nations' principal vehicle for encouraging awareness and action for the protection of the environment. 

But how can we actually measure the World situation? The World health? 

We are humbly trying to figure it out with a bunch of #datageeks. 

If you have been following the posts I have made recently with the hashtag #earthdatachallenge, it seems we found a way. 

ğŸ‘‰ We created the "World Health Indicator"
An indicator gathering other indicators and giving a score from 0 (worst) to 10 (best) on our planet's health.

And the below image the first output. 

If you want to know how we came up with this 1.79/10, the code is open-sourced here: https://lnkd.in/gwGVcf7

There are only 2 indicators so far: 

ğŸ’‰ COVID-19 Active Cases  = 0.21, with a weight of 4
ğŸŒŠ Sea Level = 4.95, with a weight of 2 
...

We intend to add more but the only constraint is the time we can allocate to the project. 

We need all the help and support we can get from the #datacommunity. 

If you are working with data, python, notebooks, or just want to support, please show some ğŸ’š, comment, contact us & contribute!

Happy World Environment Day!

ğŸ½ Next week naas.ai open-source core team is going to be trained, by a master: Denis Rothman.

Good training needs some preparation, so we are currently diving into his 3 books...
- Artificial Intelligence by ExampleÂ 
- Hands-On Explainable AIÂ 
- Transformers for Natural Language ProcessingÂ 

Â â€¦and there is already so much value in there!

Since the very beginning of the book, I got completed hooked by how brilliant the Markov Decision Process is, and how clear it is explained.

Iâ€™m not coming from the technical side of the force, Iâ€™ve always been bad at mathematics at schoolâ€¦yet I understood what I read. 

When you bring explanations and real-life examples to the play (like the analogy of the car), it totally changes the way you learn.Â 

Here is the exciting quote that will summarize our learning journey:

"Being an adaptive next-generation AI thinker involves three prerequisites:Â

TITLE: Did you know that NASA follows the â€œVital Signs of the Planetâ€? ğŸŒ ğŸš€
TEXT:
Did you know that NASA follows the â€œVital Signs of the Planetâ€? ğŸŒ ğŸš€


Yes, the agency is building the Orion spacecraft for human deep space explorationâ€¦

â€¦but they also follow the indicators that can help us understand our planet's health.Â 


What are they?

1ï¸âƒ£ Carbon Dioxide
Carbon dioxide levels in the air are at their highest in 650,000 years.

2ï¸âƒ£ Global Temperature
Nineteen of the warmest years have occurred since 2000.

3ï¸âƒ£ Arctic Ice Minimum
In 2012, Arctic summer sea ice shrank to the lowest extent on record.

4ï¸âƒ£ Ice Sheets
Satellite data show that Earth's polar ice sheets are losing mass.

5ï¸âƒ£ Sea Level
Global average sea level has risen nearly 7" (178 mm) over the past 100 years.


âœ… The data is well presented and well documented.
âŒ Yet, if you want to extract the indicators data,Â itâ€™s not that easy.Â 

You need to handle different sources and formats: TXT, CSV, Database.

No Machine Learning needed at this stage, no rocket science either, just some data mining:
- Find the source
- Understand the dataÂ 
- Build a notebook and focus on parsing and automating data access.Â

TITLE: ğŸ˜… What is this fussy concept of Citizen data scientist?
TEXT:
ğŸ˜… What is this fussy concept of Citizen data scientist?


Citizen data scienceÂ is a term coined by Gartner: a global research firm.

= a person who creates or generates analytics or predictive analysis, but whose primary job function is outside the field of statistics and analytics.
They refer to it as a â€œlabelâ€ inside the business space.Â 

âŒ No surprise why it does not appeal to a lot of people at first.Â 
ğŸ‘‡ Another definition should be more popular.

Peter Turner is a Citizen Data Scientist, he lives in Cape Town, South Africa. He is a data scientist.Â 

âœ… He defines Citizen Data Science as the fact of doing data for fun and for things you care about.Â 

Sometimes he writes articles on Medium on global data challenges.Â 
He enjoys surfing, motorbikes, diving/snorkelling, and running.

For him, good data science starts with a problem.

If you want to be successful, you need to hypothesize on something, and then try to disprove it.Â 

ğŸ‘‰ At this point in time, where we have tools that nobody had for the whole story of humanity...

...there are a lot of opportunities for people to work on data, outside of the business space.

With the #earthdatachallenge, let's start doing it.

More in ğŸ“º, ğŸ‘ and comment to support!
#citizendatascientist

TITLE: Let's be crazy enough to build a "World Health Indicator"Â ğŸŒâœŠ
TEXT:
Let's be crazy enough to build a "World Health Indicator"Â ğŸŒâœŠ
#earthdatachallenge


2 weeks ago, we were live with Peter Turner talking about "Citizen Data Science" during naas.ai Happy hours.

We launched a kind of "free-style" initiative on Earth Day = ğŸŒâœŠ The Earth Data Challenge. 


The idea ğŸ’¡ ? 

Encourage motivated people to create notebooks with the open data available on different topics regarding:
- CO2 emissions 
- Energy consumption
- Natural disaster
- Endangered species

...they are a lot of subjects!

So, how can we gather all that?

=> Can we build an indicator that can evaluate our â€œearth healthâ€ base on multiple indicators?

Maybe we can do it. Here is how :
 
âœ… Gather the notebooks contributions
âœ… Consider the best-case/ worst-case scenario (0 is worst, 10 is the best)
âœ… Weight the different indicators to calculate one
= the W.H.I. ("World Health Indicator")

This way 'Earth Health' will always be a value out of 10Â 

E.g.Â  :
A = Carbon in Air = 3/10
B = Animals going extinct per year = 5/10

Lets say WA is 2 and WB is 0.5:

Then Indicator A = 2 * 3 = 6
and   Indicator B = 0.5 * 5 = 2.5

Earth Health = (10*(6 + 2.5)) / (20 + 5) = 3.4



ğŸ‘‰ Do you think this can actually work? 

Please ğŸ‘ and comment! More details below.
#ourplanetdata #opensource #indicators

TITLE: âœŠğŸŒ. "Every species on earth reaches a maximum population after a time: the number that can be sustained on the natural resources available."Â
TEXT:
âœŠğŸŒ. "Every species on earth reaches a maximum population after a time: the number that can be sustained on the natural resources available."Â 

#earthdatachallenge update, week 1.


With nothing to restrict us, the population has grown dramatically.

On current projections, there will be 11 billion people on Earth by 2100.

But itâ€™s possibleÂ to slow, even to stop population growth well before it reaches that point.Â 

ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ. Japan did it. 
As healthcare and education improved, people's expectations and opportunities grew.

â€¦and the birth rate fell.

Their population has stabilized and nearly changed since 2000.Â 

It's happening in other places.

=> As nations develop everywhere, people choose to have fewer children.Â 

The number of children being born every year is about to level off.Â 

A key reason why the population is still growing is that we are living longer.

=> It means, we will reach a peak. ğŸ“ˆğŸ“‰

The sooner this happens, the easiest it makes everything else we have to do:

âœ…  Raise people out of poverty
âœ…  Giving all access to healthcare
âœ…  Enable girls to make longer studies
...

The trick is to raise the standard of living around the world, without increasing our impact on #earth.Â 


ğŸ‘  if you think we can do it.


â¤ï¸
#population #education #healthcare #growth

TITLE: ğŸ§¯ Start with the end. Focus on the problem.
TEXT:
ğŸ§¯ Start with the end. Focus on the problem. 
(Earth data challenge update)

I first started building a data project without even realizing what it was, 10 years ago, as an intern.

I was lucky to work close to the "big boss" that wanted a simple question to be answered: 



=> â€œDo we have the right amount of cash in bank ?â€ ğŸ› ğŸ’°


I started from a blank page, asking questions, calling people in +30 countries to understand how they worked and what kind of data I could get. 

I finally ended up with a â€œmodelâ€.

Each entity would fill it to report the cash positions and flows by nature, by banks, week after week. 

With a few copy-paste in Excel, I was able to consolidate the data, and start answering questions emerging from the first one. â˜ï¸


Today, we have better tools, but I still feel the same way.

â€œItâ€™s still day 1â€, and nobody expects you to solve a problem overnight.


Coming to the #earthdatachallenge, I "think" the question is : 

=> Can we build an indicator that can evaluate our â€œearth healthâ€ ğŸŒ âœŠ ? 

To answer that, a lot of subjects need to be addressed. 
I guess this is the real challenge.



What subjects should we choose?


PS: ğŸ‘‰ Want to help? Join with the link in the first comment.

TITLE: Earth Data Challenge - Day 1: Colors ğŸ¨
TEXT:
Earth Data Challenge - Day 1: Colors ğŸ¨

Today, I spent some time working on naas.ai to improve a script that we have already open-sourced: 

the GDP per capita and growth. 

GDP per capita and growth are very important when it comes to analyzing world data...but I will come to it in a later post.

Because what really bothered me today is the color scheme of that map. 

Colors are SO important when it comes to visualizing data. 
I think Kate Strachnyi â™• will agree ğŸ˜‰  as she is writing a book about it.

Colors help you highlight the most important aspects of your message and simplify complex graphs. 

By using contrasting colors, such as red and yellow, if you're comparing two data sets, you can simplify data and help viewers to see the big picture. 

But when it comes to maps, you need to find a color scheme that will convey the right message. 

You don't actually want to put in heavy RED or GREEN the countries with low or high GDP value or ratio because it's seen as positive/negative.

I have an idea but I wanted to ask.

ğŸ‘‰ What color scheme would you choose? 


Have a nice weekend 
#earthdatachallenge #colorscheme #share #innovation #comment #datavisualization #datastorytelling 

PS: link of the notebook template in the first comment. Feel free to make some trials ğŸ˜‰

Today is Earth Day.
An annual event first held on April 22, 1970 to demonstrate support for environmental protection. 

= 51 years ago !

It now includes a wide range of events coordinated globally by EARTHDAY.ORG including 1 billion people in more than 193 countries. 

Scope of work:
- Climate actions
- Science and education 
- People and communities 
- Conservation and reforestation 
- Plastic and pollution

Open-data should be everywhere on those subjects.

âŒBut itâ€™s not that easy.

We spent the whole day with my data mining students on the matter. 

Datasets available are :

- scattered around different organisation websites (OECD, WorldBank, NASA, FAO...)
- often raw so you need to clean them before using
- hardly up to date or on the right perimeter


âœ… If you want to help us make sense of this data. Join us for the #earthdatachallenge 

ğŸ’ªSo that next time someone want to dig into some earth related datasets, they can access it easily.

TITLE: A data project's ultimate goal is to build assets. ğŸ‘ if you agree.
TEXT:
A data project's ultimate goal is to build assets. ğŸ‘ if you agree.

If you are not sure let me develop ğŸ‘‡


ğŸ› In business, an asset is any resource owned or controlled by an economic entity.

It is anything that can be used to produce positive economic value.

Business assets represent the value of ownership that can be converted into cash ğŸ’°

=> when a #datageek writes a script for a business, he needs to deliver an output that will generate earnings or savings.


ğŸŒ In society, an asset is also a resource. But it's not owned or controlled by one entity. All the citizens can benefit from it.

Society assets represent the value that can be compounded over time for future generations.

=> when a #datageek writes a script for society, we build an output that would benefit everyone; to educate, entertain, inspire.


âŒ The problem is that it's not easy to deliver "ready to use" assets.
The cost of iteration is too high.


With naas.ai low-code formula "asset", you can generate shareable assets link to your audience in seconds.

So you can assert the value of what has been produced, faster.


PS: join us for the #earthdatachallenge2021 and let's produce value to society! More info in the comments.

TITLE: Today marks the day France has hit 100% of its greenhouse gases emission targets for the year...
TEXT:
Today marks the day France has hit 100% of its greenhouse gases emission targets for the year...

The year started less than 3 months ago...

The following is a list of steps WE can take to reduce greenhouse gas emissions:

- Reduce, Reuse, Recycle. ...
- Use Less Heat and Air Conditioning. ...
- Replace Your Light Bulbs. ...
- Drive Less and Drive Smart. ...
- Buy Energy-Efficient Products. ...
- Use Less Hot Water. ...
- Use the "Off" Switch. ...
- Plant Trees

New initiatives are emerging to make an impact as a citizen.
Time for the Planet is one of them and today I will become an associate of the project.

We need more actions, less talks.

The rest is political courage and focus.
Hope itâ€™s not too much to ask Emmanuel Macron 

Peace. 

 #climatechange  #environment  #sustainability  #climatecrisis #globalwarming

TITLE: "Artificial Intelligence is hurting our ego so bad, it's over-represented in our minds... it really hurts to be replaced by something like that we hate it !"
TEXT:
"Artificial Intelligence is hurting our ego so bad, it's over-represented in our minds... it really hurts to be replaced by something like that we hate it !" 


48 hours ago, we were live with Denis Rothman on a fascinating show about the Transformers: the next generation of AI

Denis has been working on AI all his life, and he is now sharing his knowledge and philosophy on the subject. 

Take away: 
- Transformers today are invisible: they learn from the billions of posts, videos, images on the web
- They are managed by the biggest corporations in the world 
- Those corporations use our information for free and then they sell it back to us in other forms (nothing new but just a reminder)
- Transformers outperform the current ML/AI and human intelligence algorithms because they see patterns where we see none. 

BUT 
- They are just tools, we can learn how to use them to our benefits 
- The key is to understand, clean, prepare your datasets before running them 
..and cut your work into pieces to build accurate models.


The replay is OUT guys! Please share your thoughts in the comments + subscribe/follow us for more! âœŒï¸ naas.ai

TEXT:
ğŸ’© No more bullshit. Think, write, and schedule your social media posts! 


I recently realized that the best content producers are planning their posts in advance.

Of course!
Writing a good post takes time. 

But once they are written, don't you want them to be sent at the date and time you desire automatically? 

This week, I built a use case on Twitter posts and tried to see if I could automate & schedule posts using www.naas.ai 

Twitter is one of the most popular social media platforms in the world.

BUT, if you want to build automation, you need to go through a form of 10+ questions before you get access to the API (Thibault Houdon ğŸ˜…)

So we found a way to quickly set up an automation process by using IFTTT as a proxy + plugged a Google spreadsheet as a source. 

It's very easy for tech & non-tech to use this notebook template. 
I made 2 videos about it. 
This is the 2nd one with the full workflow.

TITLE: Guys! ğŸ¥Š  We cracked how to extract and send data to your Notion workspace with low-code python formulas ğŸ
TEXT:
Guys! ğŸ¥Š  We cracked how to extract and send data to your Notion workspace with low-code python formulas ğŸ  


Notion is one of the most popular "All-in-one workspaces" because of its excellent adaptability to any kind of projects/businesses.

"One tool for your whole team. Write, plan, and get organized." is their motto.

It can enable you to replace :
- Confluence

- Trello 
- Jira 
- Asana 
- Google doc
- Evernote 
...

TITLE: How are you today? To start the year, we have big news for you: NAAS has now a FREE PLAN â¤ï¸
TEXT:
How are you today? To start the year, we have big news for you: NAAS has now a FREE PLAN â¤ï¸

Since we launched Naas.ai 3 months ago on @producthunt, the core team has been working hard to build a credit-based pricing model.

This free plan gives you access to 100 credits per month (equivalent to 3h20 of notebook uptime).

Credits will be debited based on the services you use :
- Notebook uptime = 0.5 per min
- Scheduler = 1 per min
- Webhook/API = 1 per call
- Asset sharing = 1 per call
- Notifications = 3 per message

Next week on the roadmap, we will work on the "Naas daily" email.
In this daily brief, you will be able to check your credit consumption, be informed of the latest opensource templates released by the community of notebook lovers â¤ï¸, get access to a curated list of articles on data topics.

This is a big achievement for the core team in our mission to make data, automation & AI accessible to all.

TITLE: ğŸ™‰ You donâ€™t need to become a data scientist to work with data !!!
TEXT:
ğŸ™‰ You donâ€™t need to become a data scientist to work with data !!!

Start by being a data miner. ğŸ‘·â€â™‚ï¸ğŸ‘·â€â™€ï¸


So many people think that the â€œdata fieldâ€ is not for them because the term includes a LOT of things.

The role of a data science professional is a combination of :

- an AI researcher
- a deep learning engineer, 
- a machine learning engineer, 
- a data engineer,
- a data analyst, to some extent. 

And the people understanding all that are max 2% of the population.  

Being a data miner is about :
- finding useful information in a dataset,
- dealing with structured data,
- using simple data tools to do so (excel, a jupyter notebook and bit of python are the most commonly used)



Both data science and data mining play crucial roles in helping businesses in identifying opportunities & making effective decisions. 

But letâ€™s stop putting â€œdata scienceâ€ everywhere.


Donâ€™t label yourself as a scientist.

Be a miner, 
dig into the data, 
make your hands dirty, 

... and eventually you will find the gold nugget that will make you want to eat the rest of the plate !  ğŸ¥‡

TITLE: Spreadsheets are NOT dead: hate it ğŸ˜¡ or love it ğŸ˜ ?
TEXT:
Spreadsheets are NOT dead: hate it ğŸ˜¡ or love it ğŸ˜ ?

When I was at school, everybody uses to laugh at me because I wanted to use Excel spreadsheets all the time...

to follow our music association treasury,
to plan our next event (understand Party ğŸ¥³ğŸ¾)
to make some calendar projections, 
to create forms and questionnaires 
...and eventually to make some math and calculations. 

But it's not because you CAN do pretty much everything with Excel, that you SHOULD ğŸ˜›

Recently, new players came into the game like Airtable. 
You can store information like Excel but make it more visually appealing and easy-to-use with its different view types (grid, calendar, kanban, form). 

But when you want to take this data out to do perform data analysis, automation, ML, etc => a good python notebook will always be more powerful ğŸ’ª

TITLE: Cash is king but data is Gold!
TEXT:
Cash is king but data is Gold!

There are no 100 ways to make your cash work for you. 
...and surely putting it under your bed sheet is not one.ğŸ˜´

You can : 
1/ Buy shares of companies
2/ Create your own 
3/ Invest in real estate or buy tangible assets

The idea is that those things will value over time.

Everything comes down to beating the ridiculous 0.x% your bank is offering for letting your cash in their hands while they make (big) profits out of it.

To win this game. You need to go down to the mine. You need data!

It's the most precious resource you have...but it's far from being easily accessible to the masses. 

That's why we created Naas.ai, we hope this open-source project will help anyone take back control of data and build confidence in the future.

TITLE: ğŸš€ Yesterday we launched Naas.ai on Product Hunt
TEXT:
ğŸš€ Yesterday we launched Naas.ai on Product Hunt 

...and we became #5 â­ï¸ product of the day: what a blast!ğŸ’¥

Naas is the first Jupyter based data-science platform that allows you to schedule, run, and expose all the awesome things you can with notebooks.

For the past 4 years, we've been working with Jupyter to integrate our client's data projects into their production environment. But going from notebooks to prod is a tedious process.

So we dreamed of making Jupyter a safe production environment to make data access as simple as writing on a piece of paper.ğŸ’­

Then, we realized that Netflix was on the same path! They are indeed betting heavily on notebooks to enable data access from engineers to business executives.
We share their philosophy and created Naas ğŸ“’ Notebooks as automated Services ğŸš€

We wish to make Jupyter notebooks a commodity for everyone who wants to build data intelligence, with no black box. Everything is open-source, and we created a set of awesome notebooks templates to kickstart your projects in minutes.

We would love to hear your feedback on Product Hunt!
+ Feel free to start your free trial!

#data #business #machinelearning #education #datascience #datamining #ml #ai
